medical_history.chief_complaint: Violent behavior characterized by restlessness, disorientation, delusions, and visual hallucinations.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms worsened after admission, progressing to hyperactive delirium. Initially agitated and disoriented, he later became tachycardic, severely agitated, and developed a high-grade fever and atrial fibrillation. His condition deteriorated and required four-point physical restraints. Treatment with trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole led to the development of brown urine. The patient experienced skin lesions intermittently over the last few years. After discontinuing porphyrinogenic medications and administering glucose infusions, his psychiatric symptoms resolved, and he no longer required restraints.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of dementia, insomnia, and depressive disorder.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father had a similar rash at an older age.
medical_history.social_history: The patient did not smoke tobacco, drink alcohol, or use recreational drugs.
